Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2007 08:22PM michmom wrote: I too was big breasted.  In between my reconstruction when I was "lopsided" i was fit with a prosthesis and bra that fit my remaining breast and I wore that until my 2nd surgery. txgrl01: I too had a reduction as part of my exchange surgery and it came out great.  It was such a positive thing to have come out of this whole ordeal

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2007 06:30PM michmom wrote: I never tried to contact RTR but I agreee with Iodine the Y-Me volunteers were very good. When I called and asked for someone specific to my dx I received a call back the next day and the woman was very helpful.
Posts.Title: Reach to Recovery shrink Jaybird627

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 06:49PM michmom wrote: Hi Brenda  Wishing you an easy surgery.  I had a single mast in Jan 2007.  My ps gave me this stretchie front closing bra which he put on after the surgery.  I bought extras and used them for the first 3 weeks.  I had 2 drains.  One came out after a week and the other 3 days later.  I found them the worst part of the whole ordeal because the tube was stiched in and the stitches pulled.  After 3 week I went to a specialty store and was fit with a prosthesis and mastectomy bra to use during expansion to even myself out until my second surgery.  I felt and looked fine in clothes.  I've since had exchange and reduction on the other side and my ps did a great job.  My boobs are even  and perky. Good luck and hugs to you Michele
Posts.Title: mastectomy brendar brendar

Posts.Content: May 24, 2008 12:30PM michmom wrote: When I was "uneven" between surgeries, I was fit with a prosthesis to even me out.  A good mastectomy store will fit her and then she will feel alot better about going out

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2007 03:52AM michmom wrote: Sheri  I don't have lymphedema but suffer from arm pain in the upper muscle and shoulder area.  At my check-up with the bs I mentioned it and after examining me he said the muscles in the affected arm were tighter than the other arm (deltoid muscle).  Anyway he recommnded PT and I scheduled it for this Mon.  I'm actually seeing someone certified for lymphedema figuring she must be familiar with post-mast issues,
